title: Chesapeake Bay Common Fish
description: 10 most common fish in Chesapeake Bay with appearance and fishery rules.

cards.back: Silvery body with dark stripes. Season: Spring-Fall. Min length: 28 inches. Daily limit: 2.
Blue-green back with silver sides. Season: Year-round. Min length: 12 inches. Daily limit: 10.
Silver body, slightly compressed. Season: Year-round. No min length. Daily limit: 50.
Long, snake-like body, brownish. Season: May-Oct. Min length: 9 inches. Daily limit: 25.
Brownish with dark spots. Season: Year-round. No min length. Daily limit: 50.
Silver body with a dark spot near the shoulder. Season: Year-round. No min length. Daily limit: 50.
Small, slender, silver fish. No specific season or limits; used as bait.
Whitish belly, bluish-gray back. Season: Year-round. Min length: 8 inches. Daily limit: 25.
Silver body with dark spots and a black fin. Season: Year-round. No min length. Daily limit: 50.
Silver with black spots on back and sides. Season: May-Dec. Min length: 14 inches. Daily limit: 10.

prompt: Create a deck of the ten most common fish found in the Chesapeake Bay and its estuaries. Include only fish, no shellfish.  On the front of each card, put the name of the fish.  On the back, put a brief description of it's appearance and related fishery rules for the species (e.g., Season, Minimum Keep Length, Daily Catch Limit).
